required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigational Drug Versus an Approved Drug in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis (0663-072)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Tolerability and Effectiveness of Etoricoxib 90 mg q.d. vs. Diclofenac Sodium 75 mg b.i.d. in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety of an investigational drug versus an approved drug for the relief of pain in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Discontinuations due to clinical and laboratory gastrointestinal adverse experiences

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females 50 years or older with rheumatoid arthritis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of gastrointestinal malabsorption or inflammatory bowel disease
- History of heart problems such as: congestive heart failure (CHF), heart attack or high blood pressure.
